title: Covenant Curse and Exile
objective: Trace covenant disobedience to exile consequence

segments.audio_script: This is lesson twenty-one. You are studying covenant curse and exile. Lesson twenty examined prophetic covenant critique.

Israel experiences persistent covenant violation. Prophets warn of judgment. Exile to Assyria follows northern kingdom disobedience. Babylonian exile follows southern kingdom violation. Exile is covenant curse.
Exile fulfills covenant curse predicted for disobedience. Forced removal from land is ultimate judgment. Loss of temple marks rupture in covenant worship. Yet exile is not final separation.
Key themes: exile is covenant curse for persistent disobedience. God permits destruction but remains faithful. Exile purges unfaithfulness. Judgment serves redemptive purpose.
What is the primary consequence of covenant disobedience?
This completes lesson twenty-one. You studied covenant curse and exile. Next lesson examines prophetic hope in restoration.

vocabulary.definition: Forced removal from land as covenant curse for sustained disobedience to God
Deportation of Judah to Babylon in 586 BCE following covenant violation and temple destruction

study_notes: Exile demonstrates covenant as dynamic relationship with real consequences. It is not the end of covenant but purging judgment leading to restoration.
